thread.title: Boy, 13, dies after being shot in Chinese takeout in Nicetown
thread.title_full: Boy, 13, dies after being shot in Chinese takeout in Nicetown

author: Julie Shaw
title: Boy, 13, dies after being shot in Chinese takeout in Nicetown
text:
Boy, 13, dies after being shot in Chinese takeout in Nicetown Updated: March 21, 2017 â€” 10:22 AM EDT 65 Share Julie Shaw Staff writer 
Julie Shaw works on the Real Time News Desk for the Inquirer and the Daily News. During her 10-plus years at both papers, she has covered the courts, crime, immigration, and census stories. More by Julie Shaw Arrow icon 
A 13-year-old boy who was shot in the head in a Chinese takeout restaurant in Nicetown earlier this month has died, police said Tuesday. 
The victim, Khiseer Davis-Papther, of Frankford, was shot inside the Gold Fish Chinese takeout on the 2000 block of Hunting Park Avenue about 10:30 p.m. March 10. He was taken to Temple University Hospital, where he was pronounced dead at 9:14 p.m. Sunday, police said. 
No arrest has been reported. Police said they were not aware of the motive behind the shooting. 
Chief Inspector Scott Small previously told reporters the victim was sitting at a table with friends when two males walked in. One of the males began talking to the victim, then put a gun to his head and pulled the trigger, police said. The shooter and his accomplice then fled. 
Police released still images of the two males and have asked anyone with information about them to contact the homicide unit at 215-686-3334. More Coverage
